title: VEGOILS-Palm futures track related oils lower
text:
VEGOILS-Palm futures track related oils lower

KUALA LUMPUR, Sept 18 (Reuters) - Malaysian palm oil futures fell in early trade on Wednesday, retreating from a three-week high touched in the previous session, as related vegetable oils weakened.

The benchmark palm oil contract for the November delivery FCPOc3 on the Bursa Malaysia Derivatives Exchange was down 1.1% at 2,260 ringgit per tonne, as of 0324 GMT.

The January soyoil contract on the Dalian exchange DBYF0 fell 0.4%, while the Dalian January palm oil contract DCPF0 dropped 1.5%.

Soybean oil on the Chicago Board of Trade BOc2 fell 0.2%.

FUNDAMENTALS

* A bullish target at 2,406 ringgit per tonne has been aborted for palm oil, as it failed to break a resistance at 2,290 ringgit, Wang Tao, a Reuters market analyst for commodities technicals said. TECH/C

* U.S. corn futures firmed on Wednesday, rebounding from losses of more than 1.5% in the previous session, though gains were checked by weaker oil prices and forecasts for crop-friendly weather across a key North American growing region. GRA/

* Oil prices slipped on Wednesday, extending losses from the previous session after Saudi Arabia's energy minister said the kingdom will restore lost oil production by the end of the month. O/R

MARKET NEWS

* Financial markets in Asia traded in thin ranges on Wednesday as caution prevailed ahead of an expected U.S. interest rate cut. MKTS/GLOB

* Wall Street ended higher on Tuesday as the impact of weekend attacks on Saudi Arabia's biggest oil refinery faded and investors awaited a widely expected Fed interest rate cut on Wednesday. .N

* The dollar traded near a seven-week high versus the yen as oil markets recovered from a supply shock, but the focus is firmly on a U.S. Federal Reserve meeting later on Wednesday that is widely expected to deliver an interest rate cut. USD/
